title: Coombes Valley Walking Route

images.title: Dave Dunford / Combes Brook
images.caption: Combes Brook. Looking downstream from the footbridge. An RSPB bird hide stands behind the photographer. I'd have liked to have found and photographed the Horsley Stone and Buttermilk Spring marked on the map, but they lie within a private area of the reserve.

images.title: Dave Dunford / Combes Valley
images.caption: Bench at the point where the footpath crosses Combes Brook. A bird hide overlooking a pond is nearby.

images.title: Dave Dunford / Cloughmeadow Cottage
images.caption: Cloughmeadow Cottage. View from the bird hide in RSPB Combes Valley reserve.

images.title: Dave.Dunford, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: A Grade II listed cottage in the civil parish of Ipstones

images.title: Coombes Valley Visitor Centre by Jonathan Kington, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Coombes Valley Visitor Centre. The site is the oldest RSPB reserve in the Midlands, dating back to 1962 when it was home to the last breeding pair of sparrowhawks in Staffordshire.

images.title: Dave Dunford / Low Wood, Combes Valley
images.caption: Low Wood, Combes Valley

description: This circular walk explores the lovely Coombes Valley RSPB Nature reserve near Leek in Staffordshire. There's good facilites with a parking area, information centre and picnic area. From here you can pick up various trails taking you to woodland, ponds, scrub and the pretty Coombes Brook which runs through the centre of the site. On the way you'll pass bird hides where you can look for species including Dipper, Great Spotted Woodpecker and Woodcock. The Staffordshire Moorlands Walk also runs through the area so you can pick this up to explore the surrounding countryside too.
